availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Scott (Lewis County, Kentucky, boatman & 2nd lieutenant)

body.p: Lewis County, Kentucky, boatman and soldier. Boatman in Lewis County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a second lieutenant. Arrested for desertion on September 8, 1863. Mustered out on January 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, p. 931.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 351.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 108-9.
